data.text: Great travail is created for every man,
Their imagination of things to come, and the day of death,
From him that sitteth on a throne of glory,
From him that weareth purple and a crown,
Wrath, and envy, trouble, and unquietness, fear of death, and anger, and strife,
Little or nothing is his rest,
When all is safe, he awaketh,
Such things happen unto all flesh, both man and beast,
Death, and bloodshed, strife, and sword,
These things are created for the wicked,
All things that are of the earth do turn to the earth again:
All bribery and injustice shall be blotted out:
The goods of the unjust shall be dried up like a river,
While he openeth his hand he shall rejoice:
The children of the ungodly shall not bring forth many branches:
The weed growing upon every water and bank of a river
Bountifulness is as a most fruitful garden,
To labor, and to be content with that a man hath, is a sweet life:
Children and the building of a city continue a man’s name:
Wine and music rejoice the heart:
The pipe and the psaltery make sweet melody:
Thine eye desireth favor and beauty:
A friend and companion never meet amiss:
Brethren and help are against time of trouble:
Gold and silver make the foot stand sure;
Riches and strength lift up the heart:
The fear of the Lord is a fruitful garden,
My son, lead not a beggar’s life;
The life of him that dependeth on another man’s table is not to be counted for a life;
Begging is sweet in the mouth of the shameless:
